item.description:
You are in the currency exchange market. You will be trading money with other players. 
You will have some possible secret partners. You can find out who your partner is or find out which currency is fake. There will be a secret card that shows the currency or the numbered bill that is fake for that round. Be the player with most money at the end. 
Don't get fooled by the counterfeit bills.

Contents: 
50 cards (1$, 2$, 5$, $10, $20) x 2 of 5 currencies
10 counterfeit round cards (5 money denominations, 5 of the currency)
15 secret player cards (3 of each that represent the 5 currencies)
50 score sheets (or provide your own paper and pencil)
1 starting coin

Set up:
Choose a dealer by drawing from the money cards, highest amount wins. If a ties everyone can draw and add total.
Place the starting coin in front of the dealer. Shuffle and place one counterfeit card in the center. 
Deal one secret player card to each player, put the rest aside.
Deal 5 currency cards to each player. (4-5 players deal 4)

Play:
The person to the right of the dealer will start.
Their first action is to choose one face down card to look at. 
They can look at another player's secret card or the featured counterfeit card in the center of the table.
After the player secretly looks they pass one money card to the player of their choice.
This card will remain face down on the table, not to be confused with the money in the players hands.
play then continues to the next player.
Repeat same action.

Play will continue for 5 full rounds, until everyone has used all the money in their hands.
Once all the money has been played everyone will reveal their secret identity cards.
They will flip over the money they have in front of them.
They will flip the counterfeit card in the center of the table.

Scoring:
Each player scores the amount of money in front of them
They also score the same amount as a person with the same identity
Ex. If player A has $21 and Player C has $9 and both are on the blue team, they both will get $30 for that round.


 Any currency or denomination that matches the counterfeit card in the center is void.


Conclusion:
After the first round, write down each player's score.
Move the dealer coin to the next player.
The money and identity cards will be dealt.
The counterfeit cards remain in the center, once one is used, it is out.

Play continues for 5 rounds or till each player gets to start, your choice. Total up all the rounds, player with the most cash wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable
